content:
• Monday, June 9, 2014
  • PCTI

    PCTEL pops; SA Pro author sees a buying opportunity

    • In an article embargoed until 5AM ET, SA Pro author "Dr. Hugh Akston" sees the index fund-driven selloff that has followed PCTEL's (PCTI +6.7%) removal from the S&P 600 as a buying opportunity.
    • The author believes sales have rebounded in Q2 following a rough Q1 hurt by bad weather, likes PCTEL's dividend (2.1% current yield), and urges its board to launch a tender offer to buy back 20% of shares at $8 apiece.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:33 PM
  • CHS

    Chico's +11.9% AH; company reportedly exploring sale

    • The FT reports Chico's (NYSE:CHS) is "exploring a sale to private equity," and has held talks with several firms.
    • Discussions are said to be at a preliminary stage. P-E firm Leonard Green, which bought a 1.3% stake in the apparel chain owner in April and has invested in J Crew and Sports Authority, is named as a potential suitor.
    • Shares closed regular trading today not far from a 52-week low of $14.90.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:13 PM | 2 Comments
  • CELG

    Receptos +36.7% AH; RPC1063 hits primary endpoint

    • Receptos' (RCPT) RPC1063 multiple sclerosis drug met its primary endpoint (reduction in MRI brain lesion activity) during Phase 2 trials.
    • The company adds its ongoing Phase 3 trial "has been designed to confirm and extend [Phase 2] results." Phase 2 results for the use of RPC1063 in treating ulcerative colitis are expected in Q4.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:00 PM

  • After Hour Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: KANG +4.5%. PGNX +3.0%. ONNN +2.3%. TPLM +2.3%. SNMX +2.2%.
    • Top losers, as of 5:15 p.m.: CASY -3.0%. SMCI -2.6%. MCK -2.5%. IMS -2.4%. REED -2.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:51 PM
  • KANG

    iKang EPS of -$1.24, beats on revenue

    • iKang (NASDAQ:KANG): FQ4 GAAP EPS of -$1.24 may not be comparable to consensus of -$0.11.
    • Revenue of $29.54M (+60.9% Y/Y) beats by $6.17M.
    • Shares +4.49% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:31 PM
  • ROYT

    Pacific Coast Oil Trust in 2.65M-unit secondary offering, -4.2% AH

    • Pacific Coast Oil Trust (NYSE:ROYT) -4.2% AH after announcing a secondary offering of ~2.65M trust units by selling unitholders.
    • ROYT will receive no proceeds from the offering.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:18 PM | 4 Comments
  • BAS

    Basic Energy in 6M-share secondary offering, -5.2% AH

    • Basic Energy Services (NYSE:BAS) -5.2% AH after announcing a secondary public offering of 6M common shares on behalf of selling shareholders DLJ Merchant Banking Partners III and related funds.
    • BAS will receive no proceeds from the sale.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:02 PM
  • DNDN

    Dendreon CEO stepping down; shares +2.3% AH

    • Dendreon (NASDAQ:DNDN) chairman/CEO John H. Johnson plans to step down for "personal reasons."
    • Johnson has already resigned as chairman, and lead independent director Douglas G. Watson has been appointed his replacement.
    • A search firm has been hired to find a new CEO; Johnson will keep the job until Aug. 15.
    • Investors seem pleased with the news, which comes with shares down 60% from a 52-week high of $5.38, and trading at a small fraction of their 2010/2011 highs.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM | 2 Comments
  • IGT

    IGT reportedly draws buyout interest; SGMS, BYI up in sympathy

    • Reuters reports IGT (IGT +14.3%) has "attracted interest from other gaming companies as well as private equity firms," as it works with Morgan Stanley to explore a sale.
    • Presentations for prospective buyers are reportedly being held. Sources caution uncertainty related to the selloff in IGT's shares could turn buyers away, and that a lengthy regulatory review process might await.
    • Tumbling gaming product sales have and soft game operations revenue have led IGT to deliver multiple earnings disappointments. The company's interactive (social gaming) ops have fared better.
    • Peers Scientific Games (SGMS +5.1%) and Bally (BYI +1%) have received sympathy bids.
    • Earlier: IGT jumps on takeover talk
     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM
  • ERF

    Enerplus -2.7% as shares cut to Sector Perform at RBC

    • Enerplus (ERF -2.7%) is downgraded to Sector Perform from Outperform with a $25 price target at RBC, believing shares have moved into fair value territory at current levels.
    • The firm says it could become more bullish towards ERF amid a share price pullback or improving prospects for common share dividend growth.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM | 2 Comments
  • IGT

    Takeover talk lifts International Game Technology

    • Shares of International Game Technology (IGT +12.3%) rip higher amid reports the company is exploring a sale.
    • Sources indicate the company is working with Morgan Stanley to find a buyer.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM
  • NFX

    Newfield Exploration +2.3% as target raised to $60 from $50 at FBR

    • Newfield Exploration's (NFX +2.3%) price target is raised to $60 from $50 at FBR Capital, which continues to expect certain operating milestones by year-end could have a material re-rating impact.
    • In the SCOOP, FBR believes recent well results are due to structural reasons and thus sustainable and with implications for growth rates and 3P NAV.
    • In the STACK, FBR says the marketplace does not appreciate that production and log data from 3K vertical wells form the basis of resource potential and hence are of much lower risk despite only a few horizontal wells drilled into it to date.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM

  • Idenix deal fuels rally in (certain) biotech ETFs

    • Those ETFs with more small- and mid-cap exposure like the SPDR S&P Biotech ETF (XBI +5.7%) and the PowerShares Dynamic Biotechnology & Genome Portfolio (PBE +7.4%) are partying. It also turns out the XBI and PBE are the two largest holders of Idenix stock.
    • Biotech ETFs with a focus on large caps - the iShares Nasdaq Biotechnology ETF (IBB +0.5%) and the Market Vectors Biotech ETF (BBH +0.4%) - are having more subdued sessions.
    • Previously: Merck buys Idenix
    • The rally in small cap biotech fueling a positive session for small caps overall, with the Russell 2000's (IWM +0.7%) gain outpacing the flat action in the big-cap averages.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM
  • ZEN

    Zendesk +7.2% following underwriter launches

    • Two Zendesk (NYSE:ZEN) IPO underwriters - Canaccord and Pac Crest - have launched coverage with bullish ratings, and three - Credit Suisse, Goldman, and Morgan Stanley, have issued neutral ratings.
    • Canaccord declares Zendesk to have "a best-in-class customer engagement platform" that it thinks is "better designed" than Salesforce's (NYSE:CRM) Service Cloud platform, which has a more enterprise-focused customer base. The firm expects Zendesk to head off any fresh Salesforce challenges, and to keep grabbing share from legacy vendors.
    • Pac Crest respectively sees Zendesk growing 55%, 45%, and 36% in 2014, 2015, and 2016, and asserts the company is "radically changing the customer service segment."
    • Likewise, Morgan Stanley thinks Zendesk is "disrupting an established multi-$B market with a differentiated solution." But it sees more potential upside at current levels in other cloud software names such as ServiceNow and Veeva.
    • Shares now +83% from a $9 May 15 IPO price.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM | 1 Comment
  • HK

    Halcon Resources nabs up to $400M in Tuscaloosa Marine Shale funding

    • Halcon Resources (HK -2.2%) says Apollo Global Management (APO -1.2%) will invest up to $400M in one of its wholly owned subsidiaries that will hold all of its 314K acres in the Tuscaloosa Marine Shale, which stretches across Louisiana and Mississippi.
    • Apollo will contribute $150M for 150K preferred shares of the subsidiary, with an option to buy 250K additional shares, and will receive up to 4% overriding royalty interest from 75 wells to be drilled and completed on the Tuscaloosa acreage.
    • HK also says its Horseshoe Hill 11-22-H-1 well in Mississippi had an initial daily production rate of 1,208 bbl of oil and 1.1M cf of natural gas.
    • HK already had said it plans to begin drilling 10-12 wells in the TMS this year and expects to participate in 15-20 non-operated wells.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM | 8 Comments

  • Pure-play Time Inc. looks appealing to Wells Fargo

    • Wells Fargo initiates coverage on Time Inc. (TIME) with an Outperform rating and price target range of $27 to $29.
    • The investment firm cites management's strong reputation of turning around companies in taking its bullish stance. Wells notes plenty of cost-cutting moves are still on the table.
    • Time Inc. is considered the only pure-play magazine stock on the market.
    • Shares of Time are down 2.6% on their first day of trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM
  • MVIS

    Microvision +4.1%; SA Pro author sees multiple catalysts

    • In an article embargoed until 2:26PM ET, SA Pro author Chris Katje argues Microvision's (NASDAQ:MVIS) recent smartphone projector deal with an unnamed Fortune Global 500 firm acts as a validation of its technology.
    • Katje also highlights Microvision's deals with Sony and UPS - he thinks the latter could lead to follow-on orders - and considers the company's pico projector IP portfolio a valuable asset.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:13 PM | 2 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Top 10 Gainers: IDIX +233%. ACHN +41%. HITT +29%. SYN +19%. DRL +16%. PFIE +15%. OTC:ACFN +15%. OTC:GLRI +15%. CERU +15%. FDO +14%.
    • Top 10 Losers: AMDA -17%. AMBT -13%. END -9%. ODC -8%. NSR -8%. CNSI -7%. OTC:GIGA -7%. MMS -7%. GMCR -7%. RVNC -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • JONE

    Jones Energy +5% as Brean Capital starts at Buy

    • Jones Energy (OTC:JONE +5%) is initiated with a Buy rating and $23 price target at Brean Capital, which forecasts ratable production growth thanks to a deep bench of drilling targets in the Cleveland interval of the Anadarko Basin in north Texas and west Oklahoma.
    • With among the lowest cost structures in the sector at $5.18/boe for Q1 and $4.47/boe for FY 2013, Brean believes JONE is capable of comparatively generating attractive returns through commodity price cycles.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • LULU

    Sentiment on Lululemon starts to turn

    • Analysts weighing in on Lululemon (LULU +1.5%) see a slow transition at the company as operational momentum picks up and new assortments filter in.
    • The general consensus from recent reports issued by Sterne Agee, Canaccord Genuity, and JPMorgan is that the worse period for the retailer is over.
    • Shares of LULU are down 23.7% YTD to lag peers in the athletic apparel sector by a wide margin.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM | 2 Comments
  • GST

    Gastar Exploration +4% on operations update

    • In an operations update, Gastar Exploration (GST +3.9%) says it has 20 gross recently drilled wells on production at its Hunton Oil operations in the Mid-Continent, of which 15 gross wells are non-operated in its area of mutual interest, two gross are non-operated outside the area, and three gross are operated wells.
    • Among non-operated wells, five gross wells have been placed on flowback so far in Q2, with production rates generally strong, including the Kodiak 1-29H which has reached an initial production rate of 1,666 boe/day and a 30-day average production rate of 1,259 boe.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM | 1 Comment
  • MXIM

    Cirrus falls; more Apple amplifier slots reportedly lost to Maxim

    • Pac Crest reports Maxim (MXIM +1.8%) has beaten out Cirrus Logic (CRUS -2.9%) to gain the audio amplifier slots for upcoming Apple hardware.
    • Cirrus lost the iPad Air's audio amp slots to Maxim last year. The chipmaker still has the more valuable audio codec slots for Apple's iOS product line.
    • Maxim, already a major Samsung supplier, is making new 52-week highs. In addition to Pac Crest's report, shares might be getting a lift from rival's ADI's $2B deal to acquire Hittite Microwave, a move that's fueling hopes of further industry consolidation.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM | 2 Comments
  • MMS

    Maximus slide after downgrade

    • Shares of Maximus (MMS -6.3%) slide after Raymond James chimes in with a downgrade to Market Perform from Outperform on growth concerns.
    • The company named a new CFO last Friday. Richard Nadeau will replace David Walker.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • ADI

    Chip stocks gain as semi consolidation wave continues

    • A slew of chip stocks are rallying following Analog Devices' (ADI +5.9%) $2B deal to acquire RFIC vendor Hittite Microwave.
    • The purchase is part of an M&A wave that has hit the semiconductor industry over the last 12 months, as chipmakers try to gain scale, cut opex, and grow their cross-selling opportunities by consolidating. Other deals: RF Micro/TriQuint, Avago/LSI, Microchip/ISSC.
    • ADI, which shares many telecom equipment, defense/aerospace, and automotive clients with Hittite, predicts Hittite's RF, microwave, and millimeter wave ICs will complement its RF and signal-conversion (ADC/DAC) products.
    • Several RF and analog/mixed signal chipmakers are higher, but they're not the only gainers: RFMD +1.8%. TQNT +1.8%. PSMI +2.5%. LLTC +1.6%. MSCC +2.1%. IDTI +3.8%. ATML +3.4%. IRF +1.4%. SIGM +3.9%. AMCC +3.8%.
    • Chip ETFs: SOXX, SMH, XSD, PSI, SOXL, USD, SOXS, SSG
     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • ARCO

    Arcos Dorados flies off of multi-notch BofA upgrade

    • The analysts at Bank of America Merrill Lynch do a reversal on Arcos Dorados (ARCO +7%), lifting their rating on the Latin America operator of McDonald's outlets all the way to Buy from Underperform.
    • The investment firm dug down into modifications of Venezuelan rent law to see an advantage for Arcos.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM | 1 Comment
  • DLTR

    Merger buzz lifts discounters

    • Shares of Dollar Tree (DLTR +2.1%), Big Lots (BIG +2.4%), and Fred's (FRED +3.1%) trade higher after merger consolidation buzz picks up in the sector.
    • Analysts think a thinning out of the discounter herd could help take off the promotional fervor that has dampened margins.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM
  • MCC

    Medley downgraded at JMP

    • Medley Capital (MCC -1.3%) is lower in the early-going as JMP Securities - cautious over fast portfolio growth and what it might mean for future credit quality - throws in the towel on its Outperform rating.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:38 AM
  • FDO

    Family Dollar adopts poison pill, shares still ripping higher

    • Family Dollar (NYSE:FDO) adopts a poison pill provision with a 10% ownership threshold.
    • The company says it's protecting itself from a person or group gaining control without paying a premium.
    • Carl Icahn holds 9.39% of the shares, just below the level where the shareholder rights plan activates.
    • FDO +11.5% premarket to $67.51.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM | 1 Comment

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: IDIX +234%. ACHN +32%. HITT +29%. FDO +11%. DG +8%. SQNM +5%. QTWW +5%.
    • Losers: CNSI -12%. NSR -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM | 1 Comment
  • ACHN

    Achillion up in sympathy with Idenix deal

    • Shares of Achillion Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ACHN) are up 28% premarket on robust volume in response to the announcement of Merck's acquisition of rival Hep C firm Idenix Pharmaceuticals. The transaction bodes well for Achillion's attractiveness as an acquisition target. It has a portfolio of Hepatitis C product candidates including the Fast Track-designated NS5A inhibitor ACH-3102, the NS3/4A inhibitor ACH-2684 and the NS5B inhibitior ACH-3422.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:24 AM | 2 Comments
  • MCD

    McDonald's reports on May sales

    • McDonald's (NYSE:MCD) reports global comparable-store sales rose 0.9% in May vs. 0.8% consensus.
    • Geographic comparable-store sales breakdown: U.S. -1%; Europe +0.4%; Asia/Pacific/Middle East/Africa +2.5%.
    • Systemwide sales increased 2.4% in May, or 3.4% in constant currencies.
    • MCD -0.3% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 8:08 AM | 4 Comments
  • TSN

    Tyson Foods confirms $8.55B deal to buy Hillshire Brands

    • Tyson Foods (NYSE:TSN) confirms a deal to buy Hillshire Brands (NYSE:HSH) for $63 per share in a deal valued at $8.55B.
    • The company will use cash on hand and a bridge loan to fund the acquisition.
    • Execs will discuss the merger on a conference call at 8:30 AM EST.
    • Shares of Tyson are down 2.8% in premarket action, while Hillshire Brands is up 5.1% to $61.95.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:39 AM | 2 Comments
  • AHL

    Endurance commences exchange offer for Aspen at $49.50

    • It's courting of Aspen Insurance (NYSE:AHL) repeatedly rejected, Endurance Specialty Holdings (NYSE:ENH) tenders for all Aspen shares, offering $49.50 each in cash or 0.9197 Endurance shares, or a combination ($19.80 cash and 0.5518 shares).
    • The exchange offer expires on August 29.
    • ENH CEO Jon Charman: "We again call on Aspen's board and management to act in the best interests of Aspen's shareholders by engaging with us in constructive discussions regarding our increased proposal and to cease with their rhetoric and entrenchment."
    • Previously: Endurance boosts Aspen offer to $49.50 per share; Aspen rejects
     
     
     
     
    | 7:39 AM
  • BDSI

    BioDelivery Sciences set for gap up

    • Shares of BioDelivery Sciences (NASDAQ:BDSI) are set to jump past resistance at $10 at the open this morning. Shares are up 4% premarket to $10.40 on modest volume. Friday after the close the company announced the FDA approval of Bunavail, a treatment for opioid dependence.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:25 AM
  • HITT

    Analog Devices buying Hittite Microwave for $2B

    • The all-cash deal equates to $78 per share for Hittite Microwave (NASDAQ:HITT), a 28.8% premium to the stock's Friday close.
    • Analog (NASDAQ:ADI) will fund the purchase through a combination of cash on hand and short-term debt. The deal is expected to be accretive to non-GAAP EPS, and Analog reaffirms FY14 guidance of EPS in the $0.60-$0.64 range on a 1-5% boost in revenue.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:12 AM
  • DG

    Focus turns to potential for Dollar General-Family Dollar merger

    • Jefferies upgrades Dollar General (NYSE:DG) and Family Dollar (NYSE:FDO) to a Buy rating.
    • The investment firm thinks that merger talks between Dollar General and Family Dollar  will advance due to the pressure applied by 9.4%-stakeholder Carl Icahn.
    • Premarket: DG +6.1%, FDO +9.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:57 AM

  • S&P 500 approaching 2,000 mark

    • The S&P 500 is edging to break the 2,000 mark. After Friday's close, the index would only need a 2.5% gain to boost it to the 2k level.
    • It still may take a little time to advance though, as the index has not made a 1% move in a single session in almost two months.
    • Despite the S&P moving higher, there has been mixed signals from the U.S. economy. Employment data showed on Friday 217,000 jobs added in May, recording a record level of employment since the recession in 2008. However, the U.S. economy shrank by an annual rate of 1% for the first quarter of 2014.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 AM
